content:
• Thursday, July 5, 2018
  • BIIB

    Biogen +6% after Alzheimer's drug succeeds in trial

    • Biogen (NASDAQ:BIIB) +6.4% after-hours on news that the final analysis of a Phase 2 clinical study of an Alzheimer’s drug developed with Japanese partner Eisai (OTCPK:ESALF, OTCPK:ESALY) showed positive results.
    • The companies say the study achieved statistical significance on key predefined endpoints evaluating efficacy at 18 months on slowing progression in early Alzheimer’s disease and on reduction of amyloid accumulated in the brain.
    • The trial of the BAN2401 drug involved 856 patients with early Alzheimer’s disease and five dose regimens, with the highest dose beginning to show statistically significant clinical benefit as early as six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 PM | 58 Comments
  • ERA

    Airbus to pay Era $42M, provide trade account credits in settlement

    • Era Group (NYSE:ERA) +2% after-hours as it discloses a litigation settlement with Airbus (OTCPK:EADSF, OTCPK:EADSY), which agrees to pay $42M and provide certain trade account credits.
    • Era says the agreement settles all claims it made against Airbus related to Airbus’ marketing and sale and Era’s purchase of 11 H225 model helicopters.
    • Era was in litigation with Airbus concerning the grounding of its H225s in the aftermath of a 2016 crash of a CHC H225 near Turoy, Norway, that killed all 13 aboard and the reluctance of its energy sector customers to resume flying the H225 once international aviation regulators lifted the grounding.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • RGLS

    Regulus -48.4% as it slashes 60% of workforce to stretch cash

    • Regulus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RGLS) has resumed trading and is down 48.4% after hours after announcing a strategic update and restructuring that will see it cutting about 60% of its head count.
    • In moves to extend its cash runway into 2019, Regulus is pausing recruitment activity for the RG-012 clinical program in Alport syndrome while it talks with Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) to restructure the partnership.
    • It will also focus preclinical research efforts on its Hepatitis B virus programs.
    • Regulus expects about $20M in annualized savings, which will stretch cash into the middle of next year.
    • "I am very disappointed that we need to take these drastic steps to preserve our capital, especially given the significant contributions by our dedicated employees to the progress made toward unlocking the potential of targeting microRNAs," says CEO Jay Hagan.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • ANW

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (7/5/2018)

    • Top Gainers: OTC:ANW +9.8%. CVEO +7.6%. ITRM +7.07%. PGNX +2.2%. GERN +2%.
    • Top Losers: HRI -11.7%. FBR -7.3%. PSMT -6.8%. GMS -3.8%. ACET -3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 11 Comments
  • VC

    Visteon +3% on move to MidCap 400

    • Auto-electronics maker Visteon (NYSE:VC) is up 3% after hours on news that it's moving into the S&P MidCap 400.
    • It will replace WGL Holdings (NYSE:WGL), set to be acquired by AltaGas tomorrow.
    • The index move is set to take effect before next Wednesday's open.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • CVEO

    Civeo +8% after awarding contracts for Coastal GasLink pipeline project

    • Civeo (NYSE:CVEO) +7.6% after-hours as it announces the award of contracts to supply accommodations for four locations along its Coastal GasLink pipeline project in British Columbia.
    • The Coastal GasLink pipeline project is a 670-km pipeline from the Dawson Creek area to B.C.'s west coast of B.C., which will transport natural gas to the proposed LNG Canada facility near Kitimat.
    • CVEO expects the combined facilities to reach total peak room count of more than 2K, with revenue for the contract full-term of ~C$100M during 2019-21.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • AEG

    Aegon rises 2.5% after HSBC upgrades to a `buy'

    • Aegon (NYSE:AEG) closed up 2.5% after HSBC upgrades the stock to buy from hold.
    • Previously: Aegon redeems $525M of subordinated notes (April 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 7 Comments
  • ISRG

    FDA clears Intuitive Surgical's 60 mm stapler; shares ahead 1% after hours

    • The FDA grants 510(k) clearance for Intuitive Surgical's (NASDAQ:ISRG) single-patient use 60 mm stapler, SureForm 60, which offers 120 degrees of fully wristed articulation. The company says it is compatible with the da Vinci Xi and X systems.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 6 Comments

  • Markets taking exception to rising rates

    • The minutes from the FOMC's mid-June meeting show no letup in the plan to continue hiking rates amid an "already very strong" economy.
    • The Fed may be overflowing with PhDs, but markets have the considered judgement of all investors, and they may be saying, "not so fast."
    • Since the minutes were released, the 2-10 yield curve has flattened by another three basis points to a barely visible 27 basis points  - the lowest since 2007.
    • And if rates need to head higher, why are utilities and REITs outperforming the financials by so much? Over the last three months the iShares U.S. Real Estate ETF (NYSEARCA:IYR) is up 7.3%, outperforming the XLF by a full 1,200 basis points. The Utility SPDR (XLU +0.3%) is up 3.6%, outperforming the XLF by 830 basis points.
    • ETFs: XLF, TLT, TBT, FAS, XLU, FAZ, UTG, TMV, VPU, VFH, TBF, UYG, EDV, GUT, IDU, TMF, BUI, FNCL, IYF, BTO, TTT, FUTY, ZROZ, VGLT, IYG, TLH, RYU, RYF, UBT, FXO, SEF-OLD, FINU, SPTL, UPW, DLBS
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 30 Comments
  • AEIS

    Advanced Energy Industries +4% after Raymond James upgrade

    • Advanced Energy Industries (AEIS +4.6%) surges 5% after Raymond James upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform with a $72 price target, saying the company's 9% free cash flow yield has turned the stock into an appealing deep value story despite slowing organic growth.
    • AEIS is a “blend of multiple cyclical businesses, whose cycles may or may not cancel each other out at any given time,” Ray Jay analyst Pavel Molchanov writes.
    • Yet clean tech "remains a stock picker's market," and Molchanov also downgrades NextEra Energy Partners (NEP -0.8%) to Market Perform from Outperform, saying NEE's 3.6% yield is by far the lowest among its direct peer group.
    • Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -16%) remains sharply lower after Molchanov's downgrade to Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • DLR

    Data center REITs on the move on Digital Realty report

    • A report has Digital Realty Trust (DLR +1.6%) as in talks to buy Brazilian operator Ascenty.
    • Other players: CyrusOne (CONE +2.7%), QTS Realty (QTS +1.4%), Equinix (EQIX +2.5%), CoreSite (COR +1.8%), Uniti Group (UNIT +3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 29 Comments
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy +2% following RBC upgrade, citing upbeat BP comments

    • Kosmos Energy (KOS +2.4%) is higher after RBC Capital upgrades shares to Outperform from Sector Perform with a $10 price target, raised from $7, citing higher crude oil prices and recent upbeat comments from BP, the company's partnerand operator in the Tortue gas development.
    • RBC's Al Stanton expects KOS’s balance sheet to benefit in the coming months from a number of factors including higher oil prices, the resolution of issues at the Jubilee field and a full year’s contribution from the Ceiba and Okume fields.
    • BP recently made positive comments on the Tortue operation that Stanton says led him to bring his projections more in line with the companies’ guidance, adding that investors should watch BP’s Q2 earnings report on July 31 for more details.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • ABBV

    AbbVie prevails in second AndroGel liability case; shares up 1%

    • Attorneys for AbbVie (ABBV +1.3%) successfully persuaded a Chicago district court judge to toss a previous $140M award related to allegations that the company concealed the heart attack risks of testosterone replacement therapy AndroGel.
    • It is the second win for the drug maker related to the product. In late 2017, the same judge threw out a $150M award and called for a new trial.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: AbbVie, partner to pay $448M in AndroGel antitrust case, judge rules (June 29)
    • Previously: Judge overturns jury verdict against AbbVie in AndroGel case (Dec. 22, 2017)
    • Previously: AbbVie suffers second trial loss over testosterone drug risk (Oct. 5, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 26 Comments
  • VEDL

    Indian court denies Vedanta request to reopen copper smelter

    • Vedanta (VEDL -3.6%) sinks to a 52-week low after India's environmental court denied the company's challenge of a state government's order to permanently close its Sterlite copper plant at Tuticorin following deadly protests over pollution concerns in May.
    • Vedanta Ltd., a subsidiary of billionaire Anil Agarwal-controlled Vedanta Resources (OTCPK:VDNRF), argued that the closure was based on "political considerations and to appease the public protests," but India's National Green Tribunal does not accept the company's request to reopen the smelter on an interim basis.
    • The shutdown of the smelter has lead to a 10%-plus rise in the price of copper in India.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • XPLR

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.50 PM (07/05/2018)

    • Gainers: XPLR +47%. ABIL +27%. TZOO +13%. AKTS +11%. VEON +11%.
    • Losers: CLPS -12%. UXIN -9%. BOXL -8%. WIN -7%. APPN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • TYEKF

    Thyssenkrupp CEO offers resignation

    • Thyssenkrupp (OTCPK:TYEKF +5.4%) CEO Heinrich Hiesinger has asked the company's board to accept his resignation, less than a week after sealing a joint venture deal with India’s Tata Steel.
    • Thyssenkrupp’s supervisory board will meet tomorrow to take a decision on the request from Hiesinger, a former Siemens executive who became CEO in 2011 with the task of transforming the steel and engineering company into an industrial goods and services firm.
    • Hiesinger had faced pressure from activist shareholders Cevian Capital and Elliott Management to extract more commitments from Tata Steel.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • GFELF

    More on Goodfellow's Q2 results

    • Goodfellow (OTC:GFELF) reported Q2 sales of $133.33M (-4.5% Y/Y) and net income of $1.8M or $0.21 per share compared to -$0.07 year ago.
    • Q2 SG&A expenses were $21.1M up by 7% Y/Y.
    • Geographical sales for six months: In Canada sales decreased by 9% Y/Y; USA decreased by 16% Y/Y due to reduced demand for hardwood lumber products and export sales saw an increase of 2% Y/Y.
    • Company has Cash $1.54M and Bank overdraft of $6.34M as of May 31, 2018.
    • “Despite a very harsh winter and delayed spring the Company regained its profitable trajectory as planned in Q2 2018. The Company is focused on investing in the maintenance and upgrade of its existing assets to improve efficiency and increase output. Cost control throughout the organization continues to be a main priority”, said Patrick Goodfellow, President and CEO.
    • Previously: Goodfellow  reports Q2 results (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • GRIN

    Gainers in the shipping sector

    • The Shipping sector is having a strong day as the mix of tariff, oil and macroeconomic news tilts in its favor. Only five stocks out of the 48 publicly-traded companies with a market cap of $50M or over are showing a loss for the session.
    • Leading gainers on the day include Grinrod (GRIN +11%), Navios Maritime Acquisition (NNA +9.4%), Danaos Corporation (DAC +8.4%), Navios Maritime Partners (NM +3%), Dry Ships (DRYS +4.7%), Star Bulk Carriers (SBLK +1.9%), Tsakos Energy (TNP +4.5%) and Navigator Holdings (NVGS +3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 17 Comments
  • ERJ

    Embraer -10% as Boeing deal valuation seen below expectations

    • Embraer (ERJ -10.4%) plunges ~10% after Boeing's (BA -0.3%) deal to buy a controlling stake in its commercial aircraft arm disappoints investors by implicitly valuing the Brazilian company's commercial unit at $4.75B, below analysts' expectations.
    • "Our initial take: lower than expected valuation for the Commercial Aviation segment but still an upside to Embraer's current price," according to BTG Pactual.
    • There are also serious concerns about the details, William Blair analyst Nicholas Heymann tells Barron's, as the deal is not expected to close until the end of 2019 and will require approval from Brazil’s government, which could be complicated by a general election.
    • The $3.8B that Boeing will pay for an 80% stake in ERJ’s commercial aircraft operations may not change hands until 2020, and it is not clear how much of the money will make its way to shareholders vs. bondholders, Heymann also says.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BZQ-OLD, UBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 12 Comments
  • DLR

    Bloomberg: Digital Realty in talks to buy Brazil's Ascenty

    • Digital Realty Trust (DLR +1.6%) is in discussions to acquire Brazilian data-center firm Ascenty, Bloomberg reports.
    • That could come via a joint-venture partner similar to Digital Realty's deal with Mitsubishi to invest in Japanese data centers.
    • An April report by Bloomberg valued Ascenty around $1B, though one source says any deal would be much higher than that now.
    • Ascenty has eight data centers connected by a 2,500-mile proprietary fiber network.
    • Blackstone (BX +2.5%) holds a minority stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor drops after settlement disclosure

    • Shares of American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) fall 16.6% after the company settles a trade secrets dispute in China with Sinovel for $57.5M.
    • Sinovel is paying out the settlement in two installments.
    • As part of the agreement, AMSC and its wholly-owned Austrian subsidiary, AMSC Austria GmbH, have granted Sinovel a non-exclusive license for certain AMSC intellectual property to be used solely in Sinovel’s doubly fed wind turbines.
    • America Superconductor press release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 14 Comments
  • GBR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (07/05/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +23%. SDRL +18%. HOS +11%. UUUU +9%. CSTM +7%.
    • Losers: BRN -15%. TGC -14%. MXC -12%. CHNR -6%. PGLC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • INFY

    Infosys reinstated at Add by BOB Capital Markets

    • Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) is down 1.8% in U.S. trading despite a reinstatement at BOB Capital Markets at Add.
    • The firm set a price target of 1,390 rupees -- which now implies 8% upside after the stock fell 4.5% today in Bombay.
    • In NYSE trading, shares are up 21.4% YTD and up 10.4% over the past quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • NURO

    NeuroMetrix nabs new U.S. patent covering DPNCheck; shares up 8%

    • Thinly traded nano cap NeuroMetrix (NURO +7.8%) is up on almost double normal volume in response to the news that the USPTO has issued Patent No. 10,004,445 to the company covering technology in its DPNCheck device that enhances its performance during nerve conduction studies.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCCR-OLD

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (07/05/2018)

    • Gainers: CCCR-OLD +10%. SUPV +9%. BBVA +6%. HGSH +5%. LC +5%.
    • Losers: IBKR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • S

    Barclays: T-Mobile merger would mean upside for Deutsche Telekom

    • A merger between Sprint (S +1%) and T-Mobile (TMUS +0.9%) will create value for Deutsche Telekom (DTEGY +2.6%) if it comes through, Barclays says.
    • The benefits of scale and cost synergies aren't priced in currently, the firm says, and there's some upside from other European deals (in Austria and the Netherlands).
    • It sees some 21% upside in a price target raised to €16.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 6 Comments
  • DFBG-OLD

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/05/2018)

    • Gainers: DFBG-OLD +81%. XPLR +47%. ABIL +33%. PRAN +30%. GBR +23%. AKTS +17%. PTIE +17%. EBR-B +15%. UAVS +6%. SDRL +14%.
    • Losers: AMSC -16%. BRN -16%. CLNE -13%. TGC -12%. AVXL -12%. MXC -11%. ERJ -10%. INNT -10%. TTNP -10%. BOXL -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • BBOX

    Black Box bounces after falling on liquidity warning

    • Black Box (BBOX +44%) is rebounding heavily today after taking a Tuesday tumble based on its warning that it could face bankruptcy.
    • Shares fell 63% after the company said its annual report would be late and that it expected it had liquidity to fund activities through about December 2018, "which raises a substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern beyond that date."
    • The Pittsburgh-area company had about $24M in cash and $155.7M of borrowings as of June 29.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 8 Comments
  • IFMK

    iFresh up 4% post FY results

    • iFresh (IFMK +4.6%) reported FY net sales of $136.7M (+4.4% Y/Y). Retail sales were $109.3M (+2.3% Y/Y) and wholesale sales were $27.4M (+13.7% Y/Y).
    • FY Gross margins: Overall declined by 10 bps to 21.2%; Retail declined by 112 bps to 20% and Wholesale improved by 390 bps to 26.4%
    • FY operating margin declined by 256 bps to -1.3%.
    • SG&A expenses were $30.7M up by 17.6% Y/Y.
    • Company has cash and cash equivalents of ~$0.6M as of March 31, 2018 compared to $2.5M year ago.
    • “In fiscal year 2018, we achieved accelerated growth for both net sales and gross profit. Our vertically integrated structure enables us to supply 31% of the items sold in our retail supermarkets with ten self-owned brands. Also, live seafood and other perishables constituted 64.5% of total retail sales this year. Three stores are currently under construction and expected to open in the fourth quarter of 2018”, commented Long Deng, Chairman and CEO.
    • Previously: iFresh reports FY results (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar to supply modules to Colombia’s largest PV project

    • JinkoSolar (JKS -2.2%) says it will supply 86 MW worth of solar modules to the El Paso solar park in Colombia, the country's largest photovoltaic plant.
    • JKS says the project will rely on 250K of its monocrystalline modules of 345W and 1500V and will generate an average of 176 GWh/year of clean energy.
    • The facility is under construction and expected to start commercial operations by year-end 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • IBKR

    Interactive Brokers dips for second day after June metrics release

    • Interactive Brokers (IEX:IBKR) declines about 3.7% in midday trading, two days after it released June metrics that showed client margin loan balances fell 7% during the month.
    • Today's decline adds to a 2.4% drop on July 3, the day after it released its June brokerage metrics; markets were closed on July 4 for the Independence Day holiday.
    • Sandler O'Neill analyst Richard Repetto cut his Q2 comprehensive EPS estimate for IBKR by 15 cents to 37 cents on foreign exchange effects and US Treasury moves, according to Bloomberg.
    • Previously: Interactive Brokers June DARTs up 2% from May, +17% Y/Y (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • DFBG-OLD

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (07/05/2018)

    • Gainers: DFBG-OLD +76%. LBIX-OLD +6%. FCAU +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CCCR-OLD

    China Commercial Credit surges as much as 50% after LOI with Lexiang Technology

    • Thinly traded China Commercial Credit (CCCR-OLD +8.9%) surges as much as 50% after announcing it entered a non-binding letter of intent to buy Lemon Green, which controls Beijing Lexiang Technology.
    • CCCR, a company engaged in luxury car leasing, would gain control of Lexiang Technology, an auto finance service in China. Under the LOI, CCCR would exchange a number of its shares based on the total enterprise value of Lemon Green.
    • "CCCR is focused on finance and mobility. The acquisition is a key step by CCCR to explore the financial area," says CCCR CFO Long Yi.
    • The company expects the acquisition to generate steady cash flow and create more shareholder value.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: China Commercial Credit Acquires Sorghum Investment Holdings (July 13, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • SATS

    RBC: Echostar nears Inmarsat bid but needs strong offer

    • When EchoStar (SATS -0.4%) makes a formal bid for Inmarsat (IMASY +7.3%) after an earlier rejection, it will need to come in with 750 pence a share to get traction, RBC says.
    • EchoStar's expected to bid 650 pence/share at first, vs. current pricing of 526 pence/share, with a deadline coming at 5 p.m. tomorrow.
    • The company's likely to make a formal bid as it has nothing to gain from delaying six months, with no outcome on whether the deal would get regulatory approval while risking another bidding coming in. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • RBC has an Outperform rating on Inmarsat and a 850-pence target, implying 61% upside.
    • Previously: Eutelsat backs off of Inmarsat offer; IMASY -15% (Jun. 26 2018)
    • Previously: Inmarsat +2.6% on report of Eutelsat takeover interest (Jun. 25 2018)
    • Previously: EchoStar reveals near-3% stake in target Inmarsat (Jun. 22 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • CBBWF

    Cobalt Power Group acquires Little Trout Project in Cobalt Ontario Mining Camp

    • Cobalt Power Group (OTCPK:CBBWF +23.1%)  acquires the Little Trout group of claims in the South Lorraine Township of Ontario, Canada.
    • The Little Trout property consists of 46 claim units comprising ~776 hectares of highly prospective geology for cobalt and copper mineralization. The claims are contiguous with Cobalt Power's Canadian Cobalt project.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels -17% as Ray Jay downgrades, citing 'excessive euphoria'

    • Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -17.7%) plunges after Raymond James downgrades shares to Underperform from Market Perform, as analyst Pavel Molchanov believes shares reflect "excessive euphoria" over the company's partnership with Total.
    • Shares have nearly doubled since May 10, when TOT acquired a 25% stake in CLNE and agreed to provide as much as $100M in credit support, and Molchanov says the rally has pushed CLNE's valuation to levels well above its peers, even assuming the U.S. Congress revives the tax credit for natural gas fuels - which the analyst says is far from certain.
    • Molchanov also thinks CLNE's main business of supplying compressed natural gas to municipal bus fleets faces increasing headwinds from the adoption of electric buses.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 62 Comments
  • SOIEF

    Stolt-Nielsen up 4% post Q2 results

    • Stolt-Nielsen (OTCPK:SOIEF +4.1%) reported Q2 revenue growth of 8% Y/Y to $541M. Segment revenue: Tankers $308.62M (+5.5% Y/Y), Terminals $63.88M (+5.3% Y/Y), Tank containers $143.15M (+10.4% Y/Y) and Stolt Sea farm $24.39M (+59.6% Y/Y).
    • Q2 Overall margins: Gross declined by 23 bps to 32.9% and operating declined by 135 bps to 8.9%, Adj. EBITDA declined by 189 bps to 23.6%.
    • Segment operating margin: Tankers declined by 84 bps to 8.6%; Terminals improved by 515 bps to 31.6%; Tank containers improved by 254 bps to 13.13% and Stolt sea farm improved by 42 bps to 15.9%.
    • Stolt tankers joint service sailed-in time-charter index was 0.59, compared with 0.57 in the prior quarter.
    • At Stolthaven terminals tank capacity utilization was at 90.2% compared to 87.5% year ago and at Stolt tank containers number of shipments increased by 4.8% Y/Y to ~34K.
    • Company purchased 979,035 shares under current share buyback programme at an average price of NOK 112.85 per share, for ~$13.8M, leaving ~$14.4M for further purchases.
    • “Our outlook remains fundamentally unchanged. The chemical tanker market appears to have bottomed out, but rising bunker prices will continue to have a negative impact on earnings until spot freight rates begin to reflect the higher cost base. At Stolthaven Terminals, gradual improvements in performance are expected to continue, driven by higher utilisation and operational enhancements. At Stolt Tank Containers, the outlook remains positive as global tank container demand continues to grow, the seasonal summer slowdown notwithstanding. For Stolt Sea Farm, continued overall improvement is anticipated, driven by both firming turbot prices and efforts to expand the markets for our products”, commented Niels G. Stolt-Nielsen, CEO.
    • Previously: Stolt-Nielsen reports Q2 results (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • HXL

    Hexcel upgraded to Buy at Canaccord following recent share weakness

    • Hexcel (HXL +1%) jumps as much as 3.5% after Canaccord Genuity upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with an $80 price target, raised from $70, anticipating that the acceleration in growth expected in 2018 will continue into 2019.
    • Canaccord's Ken Herbert says he is more confident that HXL's top-line growth will continue to rise and outperform the industry, with strong growth in all markets, due to its exposure to the commercial OE cycle.
    • Herbert thinks downside risk from exposure to wide-body aircraft already is priced into HXL shares and the stock's recent pullback provides an opportunity for investors to jump in.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments

  • EIA Petroleum Inventories

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories: Crude +1.2M barrels vs. -5.2M consensus, -9.9M last week.
    • Gasoline -1.5M barrels vs. -0.8M consensus, +1.2M last week.
    • Distillates +0.1M barrels vs. -0.5M consensus, +0.01M last week.
    • Futures -0.19% to $74.00.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, USL, DNO, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 72 Comments
  • PRAN

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (07/05/2018)

    • Gainers: PRAN +31%. XBIO +10%. NITE +9%. GERN +8%. VLRX +8%.
    • Losers: INNT -16%. AVXL -14%. ZYNE -13%. TRPX -9%. SRNE -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 5 Comments
  • XPLR

    Xplore Technologies jumps 46.7% post FY results

    • Xplore Technologies (XPLR +46.7%) reports FY revenue growth of 11.6% to $86.9M.
    • Achieved gross margin of 29.8%, increased by 160 bps.
    • Maintained low operating expenses of $25.2M (+5% Y/Y).
    • Adj. EBITDA of positive $3.8M, compared with negative adj. EBITDA of $0.2M in fiscal 2017.
    • Transformed Xplore into a rugged mobility company with the launch of the XBOOK line of 2-in-1 devices and entry into the $2.5B rugged handheld device market.
    • Continued to win orders across a number of targeted vertical markets, including manufacturing, industrial and government applications.
    • Furthered the company’s focus on improved domestic and international distributor and reseller relationships with the rollout of new incentive and co-promotion programs.
    • Announced a definitive agreement for Zebra Technologies to acquire Xplore for $6 per share.
    • Previously: Xplore Technologies beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (July 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 4 Comments
  • PRAN

    Early-stage study commences for Prana's lead drug PBT434; shares ahead 22%

  • CVS

    Insurers making headway on corralling drug costs with copay accumulators

    • Reuters reports that drug makers are "scrambling" to limit the financial impact of copay accumulator programs by insurers and pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs). The scheme, which forces drug manufacturers to pony up more money to assist patients with copay costs or face declining demand for their pricey meds as patients face higher out-of-pocket expenses, has gained traction and is expected to become more widely adopted next year.
    • Drug firms have implemented new tactics to evade detection by PBMs so patients can still receive financial benefits but specific details about how they work are scarce. They are also taking a tougher stance in pricing negotiations.
    • According to Sector and Sovereign Research, real U.S. drug prices dropped 5.6% in Q1.
    • CVS Health (NYSE:CVS) says its accumulator programs has enabled it to cut specialty drug spending by ~5%. Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) and UnitedHealth Group (NYSE:UNH) intend to expand their programs.
    • Selected tickers: (NYSEARCA:XLV)(NYSEARCA:IHE)(NYSEARCA:XPH)(NYSEARCA:PPH)(NYSEARCA:XBI)(NASDAQ:IBB)(NYSEARCA:VHT)(OTCQX:RHHBY)(NASDAQ:CELG)(NASDAQ:AMGN)(NASDAQ:BIIB)(NASDAQ:GILD)(NASDAQ:VRTX)(NYSE:AGN)(NYSE:ABBV)(NYSE:LLY)(NYSE:GSK)(NYSE:AZN)(NYSE:JNJ)(NYSE:MRK)(NYSE:NVS)(NYSE:PFE)(NASDAQ:SHPG)(VRX)(NYSE:TEVA)(NYSE:WCG)(NYSE:CNC)(NYSE:DPLO)(NASDAQ:WBA)(NYSE:AET)(NYSE:CI)

  • MU

    Micron bounces as analysts come out in support

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) +1.6% premarket as analysts suggest the China news is just a blip and may even help spark DRAM pricing, thus possibly prompting a positive short-term effect.
    • MU plunged 5.5% on Tuesday after a Chinese court issued a preliminary injunction temporarily blocking the company from selling 26 DRAM and NAND related items in the country.
    • "We find it almost laughable that UMC and Fujian are suing Micron for IP theft," says Evercore ISI's C.J. Muse, adding that the lawsuits ask for a total of ~$56M, "not even close" to MU's $10B-plus sales into China.
    • "Our sense is the magnitude of financial impact to Micron is much less than what the market is discounting and therefore fully reflected in today's share price," Muse writes, but "clarity on this front could take some time."
    • Stifel analyst Kevin Cassidy says China's move could pose a buying opportunity, saying the lack of details of the injunction suggests China's goal may be to push MU toward partnering with China semiconductor foundries.
    • "Based on our understanding of court proceedings in China, we think a settlement may be likely," J.P. Morgan analysts say, but MU is "being dragged front and center into the China-U.S. trade dispute as a potential bargaining chip and this could cause near-term volatility in the stock."
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 45 Comments
  • ZYNE

    Zynerba bails on ZYN001 after unsuccessful early-stage study; shares down 20% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZYNE) is down 20% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement that it will cease development of ZYN001, a prodrug of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) delivered via a transdermal patch, after a Phase 1 study failed to meet its objectives.
    • Specifically, ZYN001 did not achieve targeted THC blood levels of 5 - 15 ng/mL in 60 healthy volunteers.
    • The company says it will focus its development efforts on ZYN002 for Fragile X syndrome, developmental and epileptic encephalopathy and adult refractory epilepsy. Its cash runway, based on $52.1M in quick assets as on March 31, should extend into H2 2019.

    Automobile stocks rally on tariff relief

    • Automobile stocks are revving up after the U.S. is reported to be in discussions with Germany auto execs on a plan to eliminate tariffs on both sides of the Atlantic. The development is a sharp reversal from President Trump's threat of a 20% tariff on vehicle imports.
    • In Frankfurt trading, BMW (OTCPK:BMWYY) is up 4.27%, while Volkswagen (VLKAY, VLKPY) is 4.16% higher and Daimler (OTCPK:DDAIF) is showing a 3.36% gain.
    • In Paris, Renault (OTC:RNSDF, OTCPK:RNLSY) is up 3.15%.
    • Shares of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles are up 5.55% in Milan and are 5.98% higher in U.S. premarket trading.
    • General Motors (NYSE:GM) is up 1.62% premarket in the U.S. and Ford (NYSE:F) is 1.00% higher.
    • A formal agreement on the 0% tariff proposal will need to run through the EU and meet certain WTO criteria.

    Glencore buyback signals confidence, maybe

    • Glencore's (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY) decision to buy back $1B in shares "signals management’s confidence in its underlying business and value of its shares which is a welcome development given recent events (DOJ, DRC, etc.)," Barclays writes in a note this morning. "This does not seem a coincidence and, in our view, suggests management also believes the recent price moves are extreme."
    • The buy-back represents 1.6% of Glencore's market cap.
    • Firm pegs Glencore at Overweight, with a 450p price target (36% upside).
    • On the other hand, in a note yesterday Liberium Capital said market pessimism about Glencore is justified, even if the share price fall was probably overdone.
    • "For investors tiring of news hand-grenades in an already volatile sector, the de-rating in Glencore's multiples is justifiable. Uncertainty over the company's past dealings will persist. We expect Glencore to signal confidence with a share buyback at the interim results, but there is little else it can do to assuage investors of its innocence or that there are any other future issues forthcoming. We maintain our Sell rating as we expect further weakness in the copper price."
    • Firm's price target is 300p, implying 9% downside.
